We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Logitech’s MX Keys S combo for Mac at $154.99 shipped.  This bundle, usually priced at $200, includes two of our favorite Mac accessories – the MX Keys S keyboard and the MX Master 3S mouse. The keyboard usually costs $130 and the mouse $110 when you buy them separately, meaning you essentially save $85 by cashing in on this combo. We did see an open-box unit of this combo dip to $145 at Woot last year as part of a Logitech sale, but outside of that brief drop, this is the lowest price we’ve seen for a brand-new set, making it a great time to upgrade your Mac workstation. Head below for more details.

items.title: Grab EGO’s 56V 16-inch cordless chainsaw with a 2.5Ah battery at $249 for your 2026 cutting needs
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the EGO POWER+ 56V 16-inch Cordless Chain Saw with a 2.5Ah battery at $249 shipped, which is all the sweeter considering it’s coming in $18 under the 12-inch counterpart with a 2.5Ah battery. This larger chainsaw package has been keeping to its $279 full price since Black Friday/Cyber Monday pricing ended, with the last year having seen it gone as low as $219 a few times, and $208 once with some Prime exclusive savings during October’s Prime Day event. While it may not be the lowest price we have seen, you’re still getting a solid $30 markdown that lands things at the third-lowest price we have tracked since 2025 began.

This 3-in-1 charging station can handle your iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods in one compact setup with a Qi2-certified 15W charging pad for iPhone, a built-in Apple Watch puck, and a wireless pad for earbuds. items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Samsung’s 27-inch ViewFinity S8 (S80D) 4K monitor down to $199.99 shipped. This is regularly a $420 display, which is currently fetching $400 at Samsung’s online store. Today’s 52% discount at Amazon shaves $220 off its usual going rate, $200 below Samsung’s price. This is one of the lowest prices we have tracked for this display, and it’s now within $30 of its all-time low from when it hit $170 around the same time last year. It’s a pretty good option to consider if you’re looking to pick up a 4K monitor for your workstation, and you can learn more about it below.
